questions.question_hindi: निम्नलिखित में से किस एक से बेगार का निर्देश होता है?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Which of the following refers to corvée labor?
questions.explanation_english: In ancient Indian history, 'Vishti' (option d) refers to forced labor or corvée labor, which is synonymous with 'Begar.' 'Bali' (a) was a form of tribute or tax, 'Shulk' (b) refers to a toll or tax, and 'Udrang' (c) is not a historically recognized term in this context. Vishti was a system where labor was extracted from people without wages, often for state or temple projects.
questions.explanation_hindi: प्राचीन भारतीय इतिहास में, 'विष्टि' (विकल्प द) बेगार या बलजबरी श्रम को संदर्भित करता है। 'बलि' (अ) एक राजस्व या चंदा था, 'शुल्क' (ब) एक शुल्क या कर था, और 'उद्रंग' (स) इस संदर्भ में ऐतिहासिक रूप से मान्य शब्द नहीं है। विष्टि एक ऐसी प्रणाली थी जिसमें श्रम बिना मजदूरी के लोगों से लिया जाता था, अक्सर राज्य या मंदिर परियोजनाओं के लिए।
key_facts: Vishti was a form of forced labor in ancient India, equivalent to 'Begar.'
Bali was a tribute or tax, Shulk refers to tolls or taxes, and Udrang is not a recognized term in this context.

questions.question_hindi: निम्नलिखित में से कौनचोलसेना में शामिल नहीं थे?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Which of the following was not part of the Chola army?
questions.explanation_english: The Chola army, a prominent military force during the Chola dynasty (9th–13th centuries CE), primarily consisted of infantry (Padati), cavalry (Ashwarohi), and elephant corps (Hastisena). Chariots (Rathasena) were not a significant part of their military structure. Chariots were more commonly used in earlier periods, such as the Maurya or Gupta empires, but by the Chola era, they had been largely replaced by cavalry and elephants for mobility and warfare.
questions.explanation_hindi: चोल सेना, जो चोल वंश (9वीं-13वीं शताब्दी ई.स.) के दौरान प्रमुख सैन्य बल थी, में पैदल सेना (पदाति), सवारी (अश्वारोही) और हाथी की सेना (हस्तिसेना) शामिल थी। रथ सेना (रथसेना) चोल सेना का हिस्सा नहीं थी। रथों का उपयोग मौर्य या गुप्त साम्राज्य जैसे प्राचीन काल में अधिक होता था, लेकिन चोल काल में इन्हें सवारी और हाथियों से बदल दिया गया था।
key_facts: The Chola army relied on infantry, cavalry, and elephants for warfare.
Chariots were obsolete by the Chola period and were replaced by more mobile cavalry units.

questions.question_hindi: निम्नलिखित में कौन सही सुमेलित नहीं है?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Which of the following is incorrectly matched?
questions.explanation_english: The Pratihara kings were renowned for their strong cavalry, the Pala kings (especially Dharmapala) had a large elephant corps, and the Chalukyas were known for their robust infantry. However, the Rashtrakutas are not historically associated with having the most forts. The Chalukyas, particularly the Badami Chalukyas, are more famously linked to the construction and control of numerous forts in the Deccan region. The Rashtrakutas, while they did build forts, are more celebrated for their administrative efficiency and architectural achievements (e.g., the Kailasa Temple at Ellora). Thus, option (c) is incorrectly matched.
questions.explanation_hindi: प्रतिहार राजाओं की अश्वसेना प्रसिद्ध थी, पाल राजाओं (विशेष रूप से धर्मपाल) के पास हस्तिसेना थी, और चालुक्यों के पैदल सेना शक्तिशाली थी। हालांकि, राष्ट्रकूटों के पास सबसे अधिक दुर्ग नहीं थे। चालुक्यों, विशेष रूप से बादमी चालुक्यों के पास दक्षिणी भारत में दुर्गों का निर्माण और नियंत्रण था। राष्ट्रकूटों के दुर्गों के बजाय उनकी प्रशासनिक कुशलता और वास्तुकला (जैसे एलोरा के कैलाश मंदिर) के लिए जाना जाता है। इसलिए, विकल्प (स) गलत सुमेलित है।
questions.topic: Medieval Indian History - Military Strength of Kingdoms
key_facts: Pratihara kings were known for their strong cavalry.
Chalukyas had a significant infantry and controlled many forts in the Deccan.

questions.question_hindi: जैनलोगों ने किसके नेतृत्व में दक्षिण की ओर प्रवसन किया था?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Under whose leadership did the Jains migrate towards the south?
questions.explanation_english: The migration of Jains to the southern regions of India is historically attributed to Bhadrabahu, a prominent Digambara Jain monk. This migration occurred during a severe famine in the 3rd century BCE, leading to the establishment of the Digambara sect in South India. Bhadrabahu's leadership during this period solidified his role as a key figure in Jain history. Sthalabahu, on the other hand, is associated with the Svetambara sect and later developments, while Vardhamana Mahavira is the founder of Jainism. Triratna Das is not historically linked to this migration.
questions.explanation_hindi: जैनों के दक्षिण की ओर प्रवसन का इतिहास भद्रबाहु के नेतृत्व से जुड़ा है, जो एक प्रमुख दिगंबर जैन संत थे। यह प्रवसन 3 वीं शताब्दी ईसा पूर्व में एक गंभीर अकाल के दौरान हुआ, जिसके फलस्वरूप दक्षिण भारत में दिगंबर जैन धर्म की स्थापना हुई। भद्रबाहु की इस अवधि में नेतृत्व भूमिका जैन इतिहास में महत्वपूर्ण है। स्थलबाहु श्वेतांबर संप्रदाय से जुड़े हुए हैं, जबकि वर्धमान महावीर जैन धर्म के संस्थापक हैं। त्रिरत्न दास का इस प्रवसन से कोई संबंध नहीं है।
key_facts: The migration of Jains to South India under Bhadrabahu occurred during a famine in the 3rd century BCE.
This event led to the establishment of the Digambara sect in South India, distinguishing it from the Svetambara sect.

questions.question_hindi: मौर्योंके पश्चातभारतकी उत्तर-पश्चिमी सीमा पर किसका अधिकार था?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Who controlled the north-western frontier of India after the Mauryas?
questions.explanation_english: After the decline of the Maurya Empire (322–185 BCE), the north-western frontier of India came under the control of the Indo-Greeks (often referred to as Vaktrian Greeks in historical contexts). These Greek rulers, such as Menander I, established their rule in the region following the Mauryan collapse. The Kushans (option B) emerged later, around the 1st century CE, while the Shakas (option C) and Huns (option D) arrived even later, during the post-Gupta period. The Indo-Greeks were the immediate successors to the Mauryan north-western frontier.
questions.explanation_hindi: मौर्य साम्राज्य (322–185 ईपू) के पतन के बाद भारत के उत्तर-पश्चिमी सीमा पर वैक्ट्रीयन ग्रीक (इंडो-ग्रीक्स) का शासन हुआ। यह शासक, जैसे मेनेंडर I, मौर्य के पतन के बाद क्षेत्र पर अधिकार कर लिया। कुषाण (विकल्प B) 1 वीं शताब्दी ईस्वी में आए, जबकि शक (विकल्प C) और हूण (विकल्प D) गुप्त युग के बाद आए। वैक्ट्रीयन ग्रीक मौर्य के उत्तराधिकारी थे।
key_facts: The Indo-Greeks (Vaktrian Greeks) controlled the north-western frontier of India after the Mauryas.
The Kushans, Shakas, and Huns arrived later, with the Kushans emerging in the 1st century CE and the Huns in the 5th century CE.
